summary:
I am a Senior Customer Consultant with a specialization in developing compelling data stories. With my extensive experience in the information services industry, I have honed my skills in effectively analyzing and presenting data to tell impactful narratives.

Through my expertise in data storytelling, I have the ability to transform complex information into accessible and engaging stories that resonate with customers. I understand the power of data-driven insights in driving decision-making and can effectively communicate the value and significance of data to clients.

Whether it's presenting usage data, discussing trends, or highlighting key findings, I have a knack for crafting narratives that capture attention and drive understanding. I utilize visualizations, storytelling techniques, and effective communication strategies to deliver data stories that are not only informative but also compelling.

education.field_of_study: Dutch, English, Physics, Maths, Biology, Chemestry, Economics
Dutch, English, Physics, Maths, Chemistry, Economics

awards.title: Special Recognition
awards.description: Received a Special Recognition award for developing specialized usage tools.

awards.title: Boundlessness Award
awards.description: This award I won because of my cross-departmental work to develop a book citation tool that helps colleagues around the world to bring new insights to Elsevier book customers. I delivered the business case to the senior management team, which gave the go ahead for development. I worked with people from Strategy, Product, Marketing to finalize the tool.

awards.title: RSS Executive Club Award
awards.description: This award was given for the combination of reaching my target with a 102% in 2018 and my work on the Book Citation Tool which had a big global impact on the Books team. As part of the executive club 2018, I was invited to go to South Africa which was a combination of work and leisure, sharing best practices and team building.

awards.title: Target Award
awards.description: I was given the award to reaching my target with a 102%.

awards.title: Innovation Award
awards.description: During the 2018 Elsevier Sales Conference I was awarded for my efforts in creating new ways of sowing value to customers. By using a Scopus API, I was able to extract reference lists of publications affiliated to a research institute and map those references to the corresponding publisher. This gives a unique insight in the quantitative and qualitative data about the citing behaviour of researchers. In effect creating a new metric for measuring an ROI for Information Managers. This approach is now being further developed by Elsevier, to make it accessible for the global sales teams.

publications.name: Romania and the European Union Changes and Challenges
publications.publisher: Country Report Series II (CORE-series) European Policy Studies Universiteit van Amsterdam

profile_positions.description:
My promotion to Senior Customer Consultant at Elsevier is a result of my notable achievements in developing Book Citations insights and value usage analytics. These accomplishments have showcased my expertise and in-depth understanding of our products, as well as their profound impact on our customers.
In my role, I play a pivotal role in establishing strategic partnerships with universities and research institutes in Italy and Israel, as well as other territories. I provide advanced product training tailored to their specific needs, showcasing the transformative value of Elsevier's solutions.

Utilizing my expertise in analyzing complex usage data, I combine quantitative insights with qualitative feedback to offer actionable recommendations for optimizing product usage. The development of value usage analytics allows me to deliver in-depth reports and insights to our customers, empowering them to make data-driven decisions.

Furthermore, I actively gather high-level qualitative feedback through in-depth discussions, serving as the voice of our customers. This feedback is crucial in shaping our product strategy and driving innovation within Elsevier.

Collaborating closely with the product team, I provide valuable market intelligence and customer insights from the territories of Italy and Israel, ensuring that their specific needs are considered in product planning and feature prioritization.
profile_positions.title: Senior Customer Consultant - Italy & Israel

profile_positions.description:
As a Customer Consultant at Elsevier, I acted as a customer-facing product expert for our customers, which primarily consisted of universities and research institutes. I maintained high-level relationships with key customers, providing personalized support and ensuring their satisfaction.

My responsibilities included delivering comprehensive product training to customers, equipping them with the knowledge and skills to effectively use Elsevier products. I also presented persuasive product value stories, showcasing the benefits and value of our solutions through real-world examples.

To optimize product usage, I engaged in discussions with customers, analyzed usage data, and identified opportunities for improvement. This data-driven approach helped customers make informed decisions and maximize their experience with Elsevier products.

Furthermore, I actively gathered qualitative feedback from customers to understand their needs, challenges, and suggestions. This valuable feedback was shared with the product team to inform ongoing product enhancements, ensuring that our solutions continued to meet the evolving requirements of our customers.
profile_positions.title: Customer Consultant - Reference Content MAEU

profile_positions.description:
As a Customer Engagement Analyst, my main responsibility is to proactively reach out to customers twice during their yearly subscription to Elsevier products. This proactive contact serves two purposes. Firstly, it aims to enhance the overall service experience for the customer by actively engaging with them. Secondly, it enables me to gain a deeper understanding of the needs and challenges faced by our customers.

During these interactions, I gather valuable insights that help identify additional opportunities, challenges, or commercial needs within the customer's account. This information allows me to take the necessary actions to ensure that the customer derives maximum value from their subscription.

By actively listening to the customer's feedback, concerns, and goals, I can identify areas where Elsevier products can further support their objectives. This may involve suggesting additional product features, offering training resources, or connecting them with relevant resources and support teams within Elsevier.
profile_positions.title: Customer Engagement Analyst

profile_positions.description: As a Customer Service Representative at Elsevier, I investigated and resolved customer problems, serving as the initial point of contact for assistance. I specialized in advanced online access techniques, such as Shibboleth and Athens, and became the main contact for resolving related issues. Additionally, I focused on Scopus, a bibliographical database, and provided specialized support to customers using this product. My role was centered around ensuring customer satisfaction by promptly addressing concerns and finding appropriate solutions.
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Representative EMEA

profile_positions.description:
As a Freelance IT consultant, I had the opportunity to provide support and training services to Consulates and Institutes, including the Consulate General of the Republic of Chile, Consulate General of the Republic of Peru, and the Italian Cultural Institute in Amsterdam. In this role, I undertook a range of responsibilities to meet their specific IT needs.

One of my primary tasks was building and maintaining websites for these organizations. This involved designing and developing websites that effectively represented their respective identities and provided a user-friendly experience for visitors.

Additionally, I conducted training sessions to equip staff members with the necessary skills and knowledge to efficiently use various IT tools and systems. These sessions focused on enhancing their proficiency in utilizing software applications, network resources, and system maintenance procedures.

As part of my role, I also performed network and system maintenance to ensure the smooth operation and security of their IT infrastructure. This included managing network configurations, resolving technical issues, implementing security measures, and performing routine maintenance tasks.

Overall, as a Freelance IT consultant, my main responsibilities encompassed website building and maintenance, conducting training sessions, and providing support for network and system maintenance for Consulates and Institutes. By delivering these services, I aimed to optimize their IT operations and enhance their overall productivity.
profile_positions.title: Freelance IT consultant

profile_positions.description:
During my internship at the Italian National Commission for UNESCO, I had a diverse range of duties and responsibilities. These included conducting translations from Italian to English and vice versa, contributing to the maintenance and updating of their website, and assisting in the organization of various events. Additionally, I conducted research for my Master's thesis, benefiting from access to the office's resources and receiving guidance from officials.

Specifically, my research specialization revolved around finding measuring tools to assess the monetary value of cultural heritage. Within this domain, I focused on one particular method known as the contingent valuation method (CVM). This method allowed me to explore and analyze the economic worth associated with cultural heritage.

Throughout my internship, I actively applied my translation skills, contributed to the digital presence of the organization, assisted in event management, and conducted valuable research in the field of cultural heritage valuation using the CVM approach.
profile_positions.title: Research Internship

profile_positions.description:
As a Teacher Assistant at the University of Amsterdam, I was part of the Academic Skills department. My main role was to organize and facilitate courses that focused on teaching students the essential skills required for properly formatting their scientific output.

One of my responsibilities was guiding students on the correct formatting of reference styles, ensuring they understood and implemented the appropriate citation and referencing techniques. Additionally, I introduced them to various reference tools that could assist them in managing their references effectively.

In addition to reference management, I provided instruction and guidance on presentation skills, helping students develop effective communication techniques for delivering their research findings. I also introduced them to a range of digital resources and taught them how to leverage these tools to enhance their academic work.

Furthermore, I had the opportunity to teach domain-specific courses. For instance, I conducted courses on the use of concordance software specifically utilized in the field of linguistics. These courses aimed to equip students with the necessary skills to utilize this software effectively for linguistic analysis and research.

In summary, as a Teacher Assistant in the Academic Skills department at the University of Amsterdam, I organized courses that focused on various aspects of scientific output formatting, including reference styles, reference tools, presentation skills, and digital resource utilization. Additionally, I conducted domain-specific courses to provide specialized training in tools such as concordance software for linguistics research.
profile_positions.title: Teacher Assistent
